channel.title: South Korean Hackers Almost Crash Internet
channel.description:
http://www.breitbart.com/news/2007/02/06/D8N4JF080.html
Among the targeted "root" servers that manage global Internet traffic were ones operated by the Defense Department and the Internet's primary oversight body. "There was what appears to be some form of attack during the night hours here in California and into the morning," said John Crain, chief technical officer for the Internet Corporation for Assigned Names and Numbers. He said the attack was continuing and so was the hunt for its origin.
Well, they got close. Maybe they were just testing the waters. It was probably my former roommate at military school, Kim: [img]http://img66.imageshack.us/img66/5083/koreaneg7.jpg[/img] No, I'm not in that picture, but a fun fact is that the black kid to the right of Kim was nicknamed "Cupcake".

item.title: South Korean Hackers Almost Crash Internet
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

PaulT:

They could. South Koreans can do anything, except stop playing counterstrike.

I lolled, this is a rare occurance and worth noting.

Read full topic

item.title: South Korean Hackers Almost Crash Internet
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

moparisthebest:

People lived without the Internet for thousands of years, if it goes away you wouldn’t die

Perhaps not, but I would come close. Besides, I buy all my cigarettes and groceries online. I would starve and go through withdrawal if the internet crashed.

Read full topic

item.title: South Korean Hackers Almost Crash Internet
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

However they wouldnt and they couldnt, its just a story :p

They could. South Koreans can do anything, except stop playing counterstrike.

It wouldn't "crash the internet", but it would certainly make it fairly unusable. (No domain names)

Yeah. Crash was a gross simplification.

Read full topic
item.source: South Korean Hackers Almost Crash Internet

item.title: South Korean Hackers Almost Crash Internet

item.source: South Korean Hackers Almost Crash Internet

item.title: South Korean Hackers Almost Crash Internet
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Er, “couldn’t”?

All that happened was the root nameservers getting ddos’d. Nothing happened really, because the root nameservers aren’t running on some kiddies 2mb adsl. “Couldn’t” implies that it’s technically impossible though, and it isn’t.

It wouldn’t “crash the internet”, but it would certainly make it fairly unusable. (No domain names)

EDIT: And the root nameservers did go down once, 1997 IIRC.

Read full topic
item.source: South Korean Hackers Almost Crash Internet
